title: So, if I'm going to have posts removed for asking LGBT people to stop...
body:
Then LGBT posts begging Riot for all kinds of things should be disallowed as well. As Ulanopo put it, political discussions are against the rules, as are other controversial topics.

>  It also violates the rules against political/social/religious discussion,

Edit: I didn't think this thread would blow up like this. But I see a lot of people doubting that my posts were deleted for some reason, so here:

Notification #1

> Hey Onotori,
>
>Your removed content:
>
>   There's a lot of things I'd like to say about that, but it'd probably be considered racist, so I likely can't.
>
>    But, I can say this: Fuck representation. It's all vanity anyway.
>
> While we aren't taking any actions against your account at this time, please keep in mind that continued violation of the Boards Universal Rules and sub-board guidelines may result in future punishments.
>
> "But, I can say this: Fuck representation. It's all vanity anyway."
>
> Again, posts that incite drama and cross over into disallowed discussions are not allowed.
>
> If you have any questions about this moderation action, don't hesitate to reach out to the Boards Moderation Team via:
>
>    The NA Boards Discord
>    The Discuss the Boards sub-board
>
>-- Ulanopo

Notification #2

> Hey Onotori ,
>
>Your removed content:
>
>    Identifying so hard by what you look like to the point you throw a tantrum if you're not being "represented" and file lawsuits and all that is most definitely excessive pride.
>
>While we aren't taking any actions against your account at this time, please keep in mind that continued violation of the Boards Universal Rules and sub-board guidelines may result in future punishments.
>
>This content has been removed for existing almost entirely to provoke and cause drama. It also violates the rules against political/social/religious discussion, especially in Story, Art and Sound. This has been rolled into your current suspension.
>
>If you have any questions about this moderation action, don't hesitate to reach out to the Boards Moderation Team via:
>
>    The NA Boards Discord
>    The Discuss the Boards sub-board
>
>-- Ulanopo

replies.body:
We do delete posts that are political/religious/social, because frankly they're not usually related to League. Some champs, as well as the new Rainbow Poro icon and Riot's supporting diversity, and IDAHOTB, brings up sexuality or other social issues into discussions. Where I stand on that issue is irrelevant; it's been brought forward by Riot. Since the issue is related to League, these posts can stay. I do agree that if we're going to allow these posts up, then there should be equal opportunity to voice opposition, and that's fine so long as it's done in a respectful manner. There are posts in both threads where your comments were deleted where dissenting opinions were left up, as they were 1) done in a respectful manner and 2) furthered the discussion.

 (Edit 2043 CST) Here's one ~~taken~~ *deleted* from a recent thread about Pyke being black:

>Identifying so hard by what you look like to the point you throw a tantrum if you're not being "represented" and file lawsuits and all that is most definitely excessive pride.

That was in response to a player questioning why you thought celebrating champion diversity was "vanity," as you put it.

Here's one that I deleted from a post discussing how Riot intends to use gay characters in their game

>Fuck off with your vanity. Call me a homophobe if you want, I don't care.

These, as well as the 3 other comments that were recently removed, took a markedly different tone than any other comments on those discussions. You were not trying to be respectful, but inflammatory. Your tone and explanations to responses made it clear you weren't interested in discussing the issue, but that you wanted to anger other posters.

The second comment was surely worth of removal, the first one I'm not sure but given that I don't know the context I'll trust your judgement.

Anyway while the OP brought as example his personal experience, the thread as a whole seems more into the lines of: "treat the same way comments/threads about giving socially righteous tokens the same way you treat comments saying that we don't need them".

I know it wasn’t entirely clear, but the first post quoted was NOT deleted, and the second post was. It was meant to demonstrate that contrary opinions don’t get deleted as long as they’re respectful. Definitely could have been worded more clearly though.
Yeah i got that both were deleted or moderated, my bad.

The only thing controversial is the fact you're asking them to remove content like that in the first place. This shit should be normalized already and the fact that you think it is controversial to talk about asking for representation in the game seems pretty ridiculous to me. What they are doing doesn't effect you unless you have a problem with those groups of people existing, and if you do then you should reevaluate your life choices/opinions because it's a damn right to be respected by other human beings and to alienate people because of how you personally feel about it, whatever your thoughts on it are seems pretty unjust. 

We're literally celebrating the diversity of League, in other words: Get over yourself.

Since you guys are clearly making a controversy OVER WHETHER OR NOT SOMETHING IS CONTROVERSIAL, you're just confirming that it is indeed a controversial topic.

The layers of irony are thick here.

In fact, he is the one being discriminated because his posts are being removed.

The only thing he's asking for is equal treatment for both LGBT and non-LGBT folks on the boards and I'm assuming that's what LGBT is all about? Equality?

OP might not be out right saying he hates anyone, nor is he saying he thinks less of anyone either, or that they shouldn't be accepted. However what he is saying is he posted X about a group of persons asking for whatever it is they are asking for, telling them that they shouldn't be doing such from my understanding of the situation. 

If that's not some kind of implied "you're not welcome here" talk, then what is it? Because it's come to blows suddenly it's a social/political matter that he didn't even think to bring up until it got to this point? If it hadn't been something like retaliation we'd be having a different conversation, however from what I'm seeing that's exactly what it is. If it really broke the rules before hand he should have said that first and foremost and not even brought up anything else, however he made it personal and brought up how he didn't get something his way, so they also don't.

> No one is stopping you from being gay, you're able to get married, all that. So what point does the whole organization have? 

I think you're overlooking this part of their statement when coming to your conclusion. LGBT organizations make sense when working to obtain equal rights and helping others who feel the same way as them find a community they belong to. Outside of that focus, particularly to an outsider, these movements can indeed feel excessive and vain. 

It's hard to believe someone's "representation" argument when they're not arguing for better representation of all people/ways of life, only one particular type of people/way of life. As an example, when was the last time you saw someone in film/tv/games who was devote to their religion that wasn't portrayed as crazy or in the center of some supernatural event? Just a run of the mill average believer. To my knowledge, the only religious person in League is Illaoi, but since she's literally got her God's tentacles at her command she falls in the "supernatural" category, not a regular believer. Average believers make up a significantly larger portion of the world's population than the LGBT community, but I haven't seen anyone demanding they be represented. 

-----

Anyway, we digress. Which is precisely the reason why the topic is against the rules.

In some ways they're existence is also something tangible others can point to to say "see! Look at them! That's why I believe!" It's the same problem the Ascended have.

{{champion:85}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:98}} have struck me as more akin to martial artists. They're disciplined, they belong to a group of like minded individuals, but I'm not aware of any religious teachings associated with that discipline. (Unless you count "don't look in the Shadow Box")

{{champion:163}} I think I'm missing why you included her in the list. To my knowledge of lore (which, admittedly, is virtually non-existent for the last year), the only thing that's been mentioned is that she isn't a fan of {{champion:268}} ruling Shurima.

{{champion:112}} believes in the Glorious Revolution, and has worked towards it, but he's also the founder of that belief. That said, he seems the significantly closer to an average believer to me than the others listed. He didn't have some mechanical angel telling him to do it, he wasn't taken over by machines, he is where he is because he believes becoming one with a machine is the best way forward. Maybe you could argue he's crazy, but he's at least the closest of what you listed to an average believer.

I agree that the discussion should certainly be available as I think all relevant discussion should be allowed.  I don't think diversity in sexuality should be forced upon the characters for the sake of diversity, but I do agree that the discussion of the topic should be allowed.

Personally I'd be fine if all references to sexuality of characters was removed so long as it is not relevant to the characters (for instance Xayah and Rakan have to remain attracted to each other).  Having most characters completely ambiguous actually seems best to me though.  The information is irrelevant, and plugging it in will only serve to alienate parts of the playerbase.

Edit: Looking at some of the other comments, interactions like Zoe's little crush on Ezreal are nice, and could be added to more champions.  I still think most should be ambiguous, but having it mentioned on a few gives interesting variety.
